dict.string: Checks to see if Remote Management is enabled and for the correct user

#!/bin/bash
# Caveat: This isn't a 100% complete check, because all it does is check whether ARD is running or not and for which users, but it doesn't check if the user has total control. Still... probably good enough for now.
# See if ARDAgent is running ARDRunning=$(ps aux | grep "[A]RDAgent.app")
if [ -z "$ARDRunning" ]; then
# It's not installed echo "ARD is not running" exit 0
else # Check that all users is not enabled ARDAllUsers=$(defaults read /Library/Preferences/com.apple.RemoteManagement ARD_AllLocalUsers)
# Check number of users enabled ARDUserCount=$(dscl . -list /Users naprivs | wc -l)
# Check that the right user is enabled ARDUser=$(dscl . -list /Users naprivs | grep "FILLINTHEBLANK")
if [ -z "$ARDUser" ] || [ "$ARDUserCount" -ne 1 ] || [ "$ARDAllUsers" -eq 1 ]; then
# It's not installed echo "Users are wrong $ARDUser $ARDUserCount $ARDAllUsers" exit 0
else
# It is installed exit 1
fi
fi

#!/bin/bash # Take off any existing users RemoteManagementUsers=$(dscl . list /Users naprivs | awk '{print $1}') if [ ! -z "$RemoteManagementUsers" ]; then for EnabledUser in $RemoteManagementUsers; do sudo dscl . delete /Users/$EnabledUser naprivs done fi # Activate ARD for the FILLINTHEBLANK user sudo /System/Library/CoreServices/RemoteManagement/ARDAgent.app/Contents/Resources/kickstart -activate -configure -access -on -users FILLINTHEBLANK -privs -all -restart -agent -menu
